trans-unit.source: Serializes and deserializes <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> objects into and from XML documents.
XML serialization is the process of converting an object's public properties and fields to a serial format (in this case, XML) for storage or transport.
Deserialization re-creates the object in its original state from the XML.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer> class serializes and deserializes SAML security tokens, which have an extensible format.
Unlike many other security tokens, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens include XML elements and attributes that can be customized for an application's needs.
Some of the extensibility points for a SAML assertion include the `<saml:Advice>`, `<saml:Condition>`, and `<saml:Statement>` elements.

For more details about overriding how each of these elements are read, see the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer.LoadAdvice%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver%29>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer.LoadCondition%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver%29>, and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer.LoadStatement%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver%29> methods.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> class.
Reads the additional information provided by the SAML authority within a `<saml:Advice>` element of a SAML assertion using the specified XML reader.
The `<saml:Advice>` element within a SAML assertion is an extension point for SAML tokens.

To create a serializer that can read the custom attributes, derive a class from <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer> and override the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer.LoadAdvice%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver%29> method.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> to read the additional information provided by the SAML authority.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAdvice"></xref> that contains additional information provided by the SAML authority within a `<saml:Advice>` element of a SAML assertion.
reader is `null`
Reads a SAML assertion from the specified XML reader.
A SAML assertion is contained within a `<saml:Assertion>` element.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer.ReadToken%28System.Xml.XmlReader%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver%29> method calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer.LoadAssertion%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver%29> method to read the SAML assertion.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> to read the SAML assertion.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion"></xref> that represents the SAML assertion.
reader is `null`
Reads an attribute of the subject of a SAML security token using the specified XML reader.
When an application defines its own set of attributes, which is possible because SAML attributes is an extensibility point, a serializer that understands how to read those attributes is needed.
A SAML attribute is different than an XML attribute.
A SAML attribute is contained within a `<saml:Attribute>` element and can contain any well-formed XML, not just an attribute.

To create a serializer that can read the custom attributes, derive a class from <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer> and override the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer.LoadAttribute%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver%29> method.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> to read the attributes.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute"></xref> that represents a claim that is an attribute of the subject of a SAML security token.
Reads a condition that must be taken into account when assessing the validity of a SAML assertion using the specified XML reader.

When an application defines its own set of conditions, which is possible because the `<saml:Condition>` element is an extensibility point, a serializer that understands how to read those conditions is needed.

To create a serializer that can read the custom attributes, derive a class from <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer> and override the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer.LoadCondition%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver%29> method.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> to read the SAML condition.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlCondition"></xref> that specifies a condition that must be taken into account when assessing the validity of a SAML assertion.
reader is `null`.
Reads a set of conditions that must be taken into account when assessing the validity of a SAML assertion using the specified XML reader.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer.LoadConditions%2A> method reads the contents of a `<saml:Conditions>` element.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> to read the SAML conditions.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions"></xref> that specifies a set of conditions that must be taken into account when assessing the validity of a SAML assertion.
reader is `null`.
Reads a SAML statement using the specified XML reader.
<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens specify their claims using SAML assertions where the details of the claims are specified in SAML statements.
The SAML specification defines the following statement types:

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer.LoadStatement%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver%29> method reads the SAML statements listed previously.
When custom statements are defined and used by an application, create a serializer to read the contents of them.

To create the custom serializer, derive a class from <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer> and override the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer.LoadStatement%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver%29> method.
Custom SAML statements are contained within a `<saml:Statement>` element.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> to read the SAML statement.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlStatement"></xref> that represents the SAML statement.
reader is `null`.
Replaces the default set of XML elements and attributes that are recognized by this serializer with the specified dictionary of elements and attributes.
Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer.PopulateDictionary%2A> method when a custom set of XML elements is defined for one of the extensibility points of a SAML assertion.
Extensibility points for a SAML assertion include the `<saml:Advice>`, `<saml:Condition>`, and `<saml:Statement>` elements.

For more details about overriding how each of these elements are read, see the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer.LoadAdvice%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver%29>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer.LoadCondition%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver%29>, and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer.LoadStatement%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver%29> methods.
An <xref href="System.Xml.IXmlDictionary"></xref> that contains the set of XML elements and attributes.
Reads a SAML security token from the specified XML reader.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer.ReadToken%28System.Xml.XmlReader%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver%29> method calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer.LoadAssertion%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver%29> method to read the SAML assertion.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> to read the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> security token.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> security token.
reader is `null`
reader refers to an XML element that does not contain a digital signature.
Writes the specified SAML security token into the specified XML serializer.

Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer.WriteToken%28System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken%2CSystem.Xml.XmlWriter%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer%29> method to serialize a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token.

To deserialize a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer.ReadToken%28System.Xml.XmlReader%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver%29> method.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> to write.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> to write the SAML authorization statement.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer"></xref> that is capable of writing `KeyInfo` clauses.
writer is `null`
-or-
token is `null`
